title: Deity of Krishna vs deities of the demigods | Soulful Japa
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Maharaj

segments.key_quote: Because the Devatas are living beings. They cannot be at multiple places at the same time while Krishna does not have such limits.
segments.summary: This segment explains the fundamental difference between the Deity of Krishna and deities of demigods, highlighting Krishna's unlimited nature and ability to be present in the Deity form.

segments.key_quote: Krishna says that one who, anybody who has faith in anybody, I am seated in their heart and I make that faith steady.
segments.summary: This segment discusses how the Lord facilitates demigod worship by empowering them and how demigod deities are images, unlike Krishna's deity which is non-different from Him.

segments.key_quote: But one who has got a spiritual body, there is no difference between him and his photo.
segments.summary: This segment explains that those with spiritual bodies, like Prabhupada, are non-different from their images, which is why their photos are worshipable, similar to how Krishna manifests in the Deity.

segments.key_quote: Devatas know that they are being worshipped in this temple, that temple, that temple.
segments.summary: This segment uses the analogy of a factory owner to illustrate how demigods are aware of being worshipped and are pleased by it, but their deities are not manifestations of themselves.
